bug.short_desc: video can't be controlled by mouse
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: If I play a video under Wayland session in totem, I can't control the video using mouse. The bottom bar disappears and never appears again. Even before it disappears, it ignores all mouse clicks. The video itself also ignores all mouse clicks (double click for fullscreen, right click for menu, etc). It simply ignores the mouse. Sometimes the cursor shape is also stuck using the last shape it had, so e.g. it changes to a resize shape and then when I move it over the video, it's still a resize shape, instead of a standard pointer.
This only occurs in Wayland, not in X11 (works well there).
Quite interestingly, I have no issues when I try this in a VM, totem reacts to mouse just fine. Just on bare metal.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): mutter-3.21.90-3.fc25.x86_64 gnome-shell-3.21.90.1-1.fc25.x86_64 totem-3.21.91-1.fc25.x86_64
My hardware: ThinkPad T450s 00:02.0 VGA compatible controller [0300]: Intel Corporation HD Graphics 5500 [8086:1616] (rev 09)
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. download a movie, I used sintel_trailer-480p.ogv 2. play it in totem 3. see that you can't control the video using mouse (seek etc)
Additional info: The terminal is filled with these warnings, not sure if they're related:
(totem:3465): Gtk-WARNING **: GtkClutterOffscreen 0x7ff87400f3e0 is drawn without a current allocation. This should not happen.
(totem:3465): Gtk-WARNING **: GtkToolbar 0x56400d567b30 is drawn without a current allocation. This should not happen.
(totem:3465): Gtk-WARNING **: GtkToolItem 0x7ff87400e980 is drawn without a current allocation. This should not happen.
(totem:3465): Gtk-WARNING **: GtkBox 0x7ff87400f6b0 is drawn without a current allocation. This should not happen.
(totem:3465): Gtk-WARNING **: BaconTimeLabel 0x56400d567ec0 is drawn without a current allocation. This should not happen.
(totem:3465): Gtk-WARNING **: GtkScale 0x56400d5fe4a0 is drawn without a current allocation. This should not happen.

Downgrading to totem-3.20.1-1.fc25.x86_64 doesn't help. Proposing as a blocker: "All applications that can be launched using the standard graphical mechanism of a release-blocking desktop after a default installation of that desktop must start successfully and withstand a basic functionality test. " https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_25_Final_Release_Criteria#Default_application_functionality

I have same problem. Totem does not work on laptop, but works on VM.
totem-3.20.1-1.fc25.x86_64 mutter-3.21.90-3.fc25.x86_64 gnome-shell-3.21.90.1-1.fc25.x86_64
This should be fixed in clutter-gtk-1.8.0-2.fc25
